P099185.project_name: EMERGENCY REHABILITATION OF THE DRAINAGE AND FLOOD PROTECTION SYSTEM OF BANDA ACEH

keywords.cdata: accounting, accounting systems, ADB, auditing, auditors, audits, check valves, comparative advantage, consolidation, construction, cost effectiveness, covering, covers, Dams, disease vectors, drainage channels, drainage systems, embankments, employment, engineering, Environmental, environmental impacts, Environmental Management, equipment, equipment maintenance, Exchange Rate, expenditures, Financial Management, financial resources, flood control, FLOOD PROTECTION, flooding, floods, Funds Flow, housing, hydraulic structures, Indigenous Peoples, internal controls, Key Performance Indicators, legal framework, livelihoods, local government, Local Governments, measurements, momentum, NGOs, oil, operating costs, Pacific Region, Public Works, pumping stations, pumps, rainfall, Risk Management, rivers, Safety, sanitation, savings, sluice gates, Source Selection, storm water, sustainable management, Technical Assistance, Urban Development, Urban Drainage, valves, wastewater, water quality, Water Resources, water table

project_abstract.cdata: The Emergency Rehabilitation of the Drainage System of Banda Aceh Project aims to quickly re-establish functionality of the storm water and marine flood protection systems damaged or destroyed by the tsunami and earthquake. There are three project components:  (1) Urgent Tidal Flood Protection Program, which supplies and installs one-way flow valves at points in the system where currently sea water incursion occurs at high tides; (2) Storm Water Flood Protection Program, which reconstructs approximately five pumping stations, about 110 one-way flow valves, and repairs/renews drainage channel embankments, cleans  5 km of secondary channels, and other minor civil works; and (3) Implementation Support and Capacity Building Program, which provides consulting services to support the executing agency during implementation and for training.
